trans-unit.target: Disminución de la actividad del factor IX

trans-unit.source: Decreased activity of coagulation factor IX. Factor IX, which itself is activated by factor Xa or factor VIIa to form factor IXa, activates factor X into factor Xa
A type of keratitis characterized by inflammation in pinpoint areas of the corneal epithelium
The presence of spots or rounded patches of abnormally increased density of metaphyseal bone
Both lungs have three lobes. Normally, the left lung has two lobes, whereas the right lung has three lobes

trans-unit.target: Morfología anómala del colágeno fibrilar óseo

trans-unit.source: Any structural anomaly of the connective tissue bundles in the extracellular matrix of bone tissue that are composed of collagen, and play a role in tissue strength and elasticity
Any anomaly in the formation of the bony substance of the sternum
An abnormally increased diphosphate(4-) concentration in the blood. Diphosphate(4-), as ester with two phosphate groups, is also known as pyrophosphate
Abnormality of the wing of the ilium
An anomaly of the ilium ala. This is the large expanded portion of the ilum which bounds the greater pelvis laterally
Pain in the lower back and hip radiating in the distribution of the sciatic nerve
Any anomaly in the function of thrombocytes

trans-unit.target: Alteración de la agregación plaquetaria inducida por ácido araquidónico

trans-unit.source: Abnormal response to arachidonic acid as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of arachidonic acid

trans-unit.target: Alteración de la agregación plaquetaria inducida por ristocetina

trans-unit.source: Abnormal response to ristocetin as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of ristocetin

trans-unit.target: Alteración de la agregación plaquetaria inducida por trombina

trans-unit.source: Abnormal response to thrombin or thrombin mimetics as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of thrombin (or thrombin mimetics)
Abnormal number of platelets per volume of blood. In a healthy adult, a normal platelet count is between 150,000 and 450,000 per microliter of blood
Low platelet count following administration of unfractionated or (less commonly) low-molecular weight heparin
An anomaly in platelet form, ultrastructure, or intracellular organelles

Anomalous size of platelets. Most normal sized platelets are 1.5 to 3 micrometers in diameter. Large platelets are 4 to 7 micrometers. Giant platelets are larger than 7 micrometers and usually 10 to 20 micrometers

trans-unit.target: Aumento de volumen medio de plaquetas

trans-unit.source: Average platelet volume above the upper limit of the normal reference interval

trans-unit.target: Expresión anormal de las proteínas de la membrana plaquetaria

trans-unit.source: Presence of reduced amount of a membrane protein on the cell membrane of platelets. This feature is typically measured by flow cytometry

trans-unit.target: Disminución de la glicoproteína plaquetaria Ib-IX-V

trans-unit.source: Decreased cell membrane concentration of the glycoprotein complex Ib-IX-V
An acute form of disseminated intravascular coagulation. Acute DIC can occur following sudden exposure of blood to procoagulants, with the compensatory hemostatic mechanisms becoming overwhelmed

trans-unit.target: Disminución de la glicoproteína plaquetaria VI

trans-unit.source: Decreased cell membrane concentration of glycoprotein VI
Decreased cell membrane concentration of P2Y12 receptor
An anomaly of alpha or dense granules or platelet lysosomes
Abnormal bleeding of the umbilical stump following separation of the cord at approximately 7-10 days after birth
Bleeding from vessels of the various tissues of the eye
Bleeding in the anterior chamber of the eye
Hemorrhage from the vessels of the choroid

trans-unit.target: Hemorragia que requiere transfusión de glóbulos rojos

trans-unit.source: Bleeding sufficiently severe as to require red cell transfusion (WHO Grade 3 or 4)
Bleeding with minor or no trauma
trans-unit.target: Sangrado tras trauma menor o ausencia del mismo

trans-unit.source: Significant bleeding or hemorrhage without significant precipitating factor
Prolonged or protracted bleeding following an invasive procedure or intervention
Significant maternal haemorrhage/blood loss following deilvery of a child
Number of leukocytes per volume of blood beyond normal limits
Impaired thromboxane A2 agonist-induced platelet aggregation
trans-unit.target: Alteración de la agregación plaquetaria inducida por el agonista tromboxano A2

trans-unit.source: Abnormal response to thromboxane as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of thromboxane A2 receptor agonists
Anemia due to reduced life span of red cells
trans-unit.target: Anemia secundaria a la menor duración de la vida de los glóbulos rojos

trans-unit.source: A type of anemia related to a reduction in the average life span of red blood cells in the peripheral circulation, which is normally around 120 days
#Anaemia due to reduced life span of red cells
Bleeding beneath the mucous membrane that lines the inner surface of the eyelid
Increased number of neutrophils circulating in blood
An abnormality of the level of activity of circulating fibrinogen
Increased concentration of fibrinogen in the blood
Decreased concentration of fibrinogen in the blood
Anomaly in the level or the function of hemoglobin, the oxygen-carrying protein of erythrocytes
Hemoglobin H (HbH) contains four beta-globin chains. It is normally not present at all in blood, but may make up about 1-40 percent of all hemoglobin in HbH disease, a subform of alpha thalassemia

Hemoglobin F (HbF) contains two globin alpha chains and two globin gamma chains. It is the main form of hemoglobin in the fetus during the last seven months of intrauterine development and in the half year of postnatal life. In adults it normally makes up less than one percent of all hemoglobiin. This term refers to an increase in HbF above this limit. In beta thalassemia major, it may represent over 90 percent of all hemoglobin, and in beta thalassemia minor it may make up between 0.5 to 4 percent

Hemoglobin A (HbA) contains two globin alpha chains and two globin beta chains. HbA is normally the main adult hemoglobin, representing about 96-98 percent of all hemoglobin. This term represents a decreased in the proportion of HbA below this limit, and can be seen in various forms of thalassemia

trans-unit.target: Disminución de la síntesis de la relación beta/alfa

trans-unit.source: A reduction in the ratio of production of beta globin to that of alpha globin. This is the major abnormality in the various forms of beta thalassemia

trans-unit.target: Disminución de la síntesis de la relación alfa / beta

trans-unit.source: A reduction in the ratio of production of alpha globin to that of beta globin. This is the major abnormality in the various forms of alpha thalassemia
Missing radius bone on one side only associated with congenital failure of development
Abnormally flat shape of the heads of the metacarpal bones
Shortening of all phalanges of fingers
trans-unit.target: Acortamiento de todas las falanges de los dedos de la manos

trans-unit.source: Abnormal reduction in length affecting all phalanges
An anomaly of a metacarpophalangeal joint
An anomaly of the glenoid fossa, also known as the glenoid cavity, which is the articular surface of the scapula that articulates with the head of the humerus
Excessive, increased hair growth located in the lumbar region
Excessive, increased hair growth located in the thoracic region
Abnormal calcification in the cardiovascular system

trans-unit.target: Amiotrofia extensor del dedo del pie

trans-unit.source: Atrophy of the extensor digitorum longus muscles, which mediate extension of the toes

trans-unit.target: Clinodactilia del cuarto dedo del pie

trans-unit.source: Bending or curvature of a fourth toe in the tibial direction (i.e., towards the big toe)
Accumulation of pus in the pleural cavity

A type of pleural effusion with a transudate (extravascular fluid with low protein content and a low specific gravity). Pleural effusions can be classified as transudates or exudates based on Light's criteria, which classify an effusion as exudate if one or more of the following are present: (1) the ratio of pleural fluid protein to serum protein is greater than 0.5, (2) the ratio of pleural fluid lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) to serum LDH is greater than 0.6, or (3) the pleural fluid LDH level is greater than two thirds of the upper limit of normal for serum LDH

A type of pleural effusion with a exudate (extravascular fluid that has exuded out of a tissue or its capillaries due to injury or inflammation). Pleural effusions can be classified as transudates or exudates based on Light's criteria, which classify an effusion as exudate if one or more of the following are present: (1) the ratio of pleural fluid protein to serum protein is greater than 0.5, (2) the ratio of pleural fluid lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) to serum LDH is greater than 0.6, or (3) the pleural fluid LDH level is greater than two thirds of the upper limit of normal for serum LDH
Abnormal activity of mitochondrial respiratory chain
trans-unit.target: Actividad anormal de la cadena respiratoria mitocondrial

trans-unit.source: An increased or decreased activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain
Decreased activity of mitochondrial complex I
trans-unit.target: Disminución de la actividad del complejo i mitocondrial

trans-unit.source: A reduction in the activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I, which is part of the electron transport chain in mitochondria
Decreased activity of mitochondrial complex III
trans-unit.target: Disminución de la actividad del complejo iii mitocondrial

trans-unit.source: A reduction in the activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain complex III, which is part of the electron transport chain in mitochondria
Decreased activity of mitochondrial ATP synthase complex
trans-unit.target: Disminución de la actividad del complejo de la atp sintasa mitocondrial

trans-unit.source: A reduction in the activity of the mitochondrial proton-transporting ATP synthase complex, which makes ATP via oxidative phosphorylation, and is sometimes described as Complex V of the electron transport chain

trans-unit.target: Desplazamiento proximal del dedo gordo del pie

trans-unit.source: Proximal mislocalization of the big toe from its normal position
One or more digit that appears disproportionately short compared to the hand/foot, whereby either the entire digit or a specific phalanx is shortened

trans-unit.target: Acortamiento de la falange proximal del dedo gordo del pie

trans-unit.source: Developmental hypoplasia (shortening) of proximal phalanx of toe
Hypersegmentation of proximal phalanx of third finger
trans-unit.target: Hipersegmentación de la falange proximal del tercer dedo de la mano

trans-unit.source: Presence of an additional phalanx-like bone, producing an extra, wedge-shaped bone at the base of the proximal phalanx of the third finger

An anomaly of the cerebellar peduncles. The superior, middle, and inferior cerebellar peduncles emerge from the cerebellum. The superior cerebellar penduncles connect the cerebellum to the midbrain, the middle cerebellar peduncles connect the cerebellum to the pons, and the inferior cerebellar peduncle connects the medulla spinalis and medulla oblongata with the cerebellum
Abnormality of the superior cerebellar peduncle
An anomaly of the superior cerebellar peduncle
Increased length of the superior cerebellar peduncle
#Elongated superior cerebellar peduncles #Long cerebellar peduncle #Long cerebellar peduncles
Abnormal outpouching or sac-like dilatation in the wall of the inferior mesenteric artery or superior mesenteric artery
Decreased concentration of urate in the urine
A decreased concentration of total carnitine in the blood

trans-unit.target: Hipoplasia de la uña del quinto dedo del pie

trans-unit.source: Underdeveloped nails of the fifth toes

trans-unit.target: Sindactilia cutánea completa de dedos 3-4 de la mano

trans-unit.source: A soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between fingers 4 and 4
An abnormality of the shape of the thoracic vertebra T12 such that it is wedge-shaped (narrow towards the front)
#Anterior wedging of the 12th thoracic vertebra #Wedge-shaped 12th thoracic vertebra
An abnormality of the shape of the lumbar vertebra L2 such that it is wedge-shaped (narrow towards the front)
Increased concentration of sulfate in the urine
Increased concentration of thiosulfate(2-) in the urine
A type of vasculitis (inflammation of blood vessel walls) that affects blood vessels that are smaller than arteries, i.e., arterioles, venules, and capilllaries

Bronchiolitis obliterans organizing pneumonia (BOOP) is and interstitial lung abnormalitiy characterized histopathologically by plugs of granulation tissue lying within small airways, alveolar ducts, and alveoli and by chronic inflammatory cell infiltration in alveolar walls. Patients with BOOP generally present with subacute illness, including shortness of breath, fever, malaise, and weight loss
Inflammation and fibrosis of the bronchioles leading to partial or complete obstruction of these airways
An infection of the upper or lower respiratory tract
An acute infection of the upper or lower respiratory tract
Acute inflammation of the lung due to an infection
Pneumonia due to the aspiration (breathing in) of food, liquid, or gastric contents into the upper respiratory tract
An acute episode of pneumonia due to the aspiration (breathing in) of food, liquid, or gastric contents into the upper respiratory tract
Diffuse benign transformation of the hepatic parenchyma into small regenerative nodules with minimal or no fibrosis
#Nodular transformation of liver #Noncirrhotic nodulation #Partial nodular transformation of liver

The presence of multiple granulomas in the liver as based on pathological examination. Granulomas are small 0.5 to 2 mm collections of modified macrophages called epithelioid cells usually surrounded by lymphocytes

A lymphoproliferative abnormality of the intestine characterized by numerous visible mucosal nodules measuring up to, and rarely exceeding, 0.5 cm in diameter Histologically, hyperplastic lymphoid follicles with large germinal centres are seen in the lamina propria and superficial submucosa. There is enlargement of the mucosal B cell follicles caused by hyperplasia of the follicle centres; surrounded by a normal appearing mantle zone. Disease may involve the stomach, the entire small intestine, and the large intestine

An abnormality of the pectoral muscle, comprising the pectoralis major, a thick, fan-shaped muscle of the anterior chest and the pectoralis minor, a thin, triangular muscle situated underneath the pectoralis major
A small hole through the whole thickness of the retina
Unilateral hypoplasia of pectoralis major muscle
trans-unit.target: Hipoplasia unilateral del músculo pectoral mayor

trans-unit.source: Hypoplasia (underdevelopment) of the pectoralis minor on only one side of the chest
The presence of gliosis in the substantia nigra

Absence of any measurable level of sperm in his semen, resulting from a defect in the production of spermatozoa in the testes. Can be differentiated from obstructive azoospermia on the basis of testicular biopsy

Absence of any measurable level of sperm in his semen, resulting from post-testicular obstruction or retrograde ejaculation. Can be differentiated from obstructive azoospermia on the basis of testicular biopsy

Absence of any measurable level of sperm in his semen, due to a hypothalamic or pituitary abnormality diagnosed with hypo-gonadotropic-hypogonadism. The diagnosis is made on the basis of low LH and FSH levels and low or normal testosterone levels
History of repeated intermittent involuntary muscle contractions that were painful

trans-unit.target: Anormalidad en el metabolismo de la citrulina

trans-unit.source: Abnormality of a metabolism or concentration of citrulline
An increased concentration of citrulline in the blood
A reduced concentration of copper in the blood
Impaired ability to eat related to problems gathering food and getting ready to suck, chew, or swallow it
An elevated concentration of luteinizing hormone in the blood
Amyloid deposition in the walls of leptomeningeal and cortical arteries, arterioles, and less often capillaries and veins of the central nervous system

An exaggerated wealing tendency when the skin is stroked, that is, formation of red, itchy bumps and lines on the skin as a result of pressure on the skin (for instance, stroking the skin with a pen or tongue depressor)
Abnormally low glucose concentration content in the cerebrospinal fluid
Repeated episodes of sudden-onset and transient lethargy
Replacement of bone marrow by fibrous tissue

trans-unit.target: Pérdida de la audición inducida por aminoglucósidos

trans-unit.source: Partial or complete loss of hearing following ingestion of aminoglycoside antibiotics
An increased concentration of catecholamine in the urine
An increased concentration of homovanillic acid in the urine
An increased concentration of vanillylmandelic acid in the urine
An increased concentration of dopamine in the urine
Gallstones composed primarily of cholesterol, usually about 2-3 cm in length with an oval form and a yellow or green/brown color
Gallstones composed primarily of bilirubin and calcium salts (calcium bilirubinate) with a low cholesterol concentration
A type of pigment gallstone that is hard and black, containing calcium carbonate and calcium phosphates
A type of pigment gallstone that is brown, containing calcium fatty acids. These stones are softer than black pigment gallstones
Failure of formation of the lumen of the gallbladder, often associated with gallbladder hypoplasia
Clay colored stools lacking bile pigment
Formation of abnormal, extraskeletal bony tissue, i.e., the presence of bone in soft tissue where bone normally does not exist

trans-unit.target: Osificación ectópica en el tejido muscular

trans-unit.source: Formation of abnormal bony tissue within muscle tissue

trans-unit.target: Osificación ectópica en el tejido del tendón

trans-unit.source: Formation of abnormal bony tissue within tendon tissue
Formation of abnormal bony tissue within ligament tissue

trans-unit.target: Alteración de la fisiología de los neutrófilos

trans-unit.source: A deviation from the normal range of neutrophil cell counts in the circulation

trans-unit.target: Alteración de la morfología de los neutrófilos

trans-unit.source: An abnormal form or size of neutrophils

trans-unit.target: Alteración de la actividad bactericida de los neutrófilos

trans-unit.source: A reduction in the ability of neutrophils to kill bacteria
An abnormality of the interatrial septum

A bulging of the interatrial septum towards one side. IN adults, atrial septal aneurysm can be defined as a protrusion of the aneurysm of >10 mm beyond the plane of the atrial septum as measured by transesophageal echocardiography

trans-unit.target: Aumento de la actividad del factor V

trans-unit.source: Increased activity of coagulation factor V, Factor V, which is activated to factor Va by means of minute amounts of thrombin (and inactivated by larger amounts of thrombin). Activated factor V (fVa) is a cofactor in the formation of the prothrombinase complex
Abnormally increased level of blood lactate following a meal
An increased concentration of glucose in the blood following a meal
A persecutory delusion of supposed hostility of others
EEG with generalized sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec
EEG with repetitive generalized sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec
Affective, mnemonic or composite perceptual auras with subjective qualities similar to those experienced in life but are recognized by the subject as occurring outside of actual context
Affective auras with subjective qualities similar to those experienced in life but are recognized by the subject as occurring outside of actual context
Auras which reflect ictal dysmnesia such as: feelings as familiarity (deja-vu) and unfamiliarity (jamais-vu)

trans-unit.target: Deja vu o fenómeno de lo "ya visto"

trans-unit.source: A subjective feeling that an experience which is occurring for the first time has been experienced before

trans-unit.target: Jamais vu o fenómeno de lo "jamás visto"

trans-unit.source: A subjective feeling that an experience which has occurred before is being experienced for the first time
Auras with creation of composite perceptions without corresponding external stimuli involving visual, auditory, somatosensory, olfactory and/or gustatory phenomena
Auras with an alteration of actual percepts involving the visual, auditory, somatosensory, olfactory or gustatory systems
EEG with central focal spike waves
trans-unit.target: EEG con ondas pico focales centrales

trans-unit.source: EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the central region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave
EEG with frontal focal spike waves
trans-unit.target: EEG con ondas pico focales frontales

trans-unit.source: EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the frontal region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave
EEG with occipital focal spike waves
trans-unit.target: EEG con ondas pico focales occipitales

trans-unit.source: EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the occipital region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave
EEG with parietal focal spike waves
trans-unit.target: EEG con ondas pico focales parietales

trans-unit.source: EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the parietal region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave
EEG with temporal focal spike waves
trans-unit.target: EEG con ondas pico focales temporales

trans-unit.source: EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the parietal region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave
EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the central region
EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the frontal region
EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the occipital region
EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the parietal region
EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the temporal region
Complete dislocation of the lens of the eye
Aorta descends on right instead of on the left
Persistence of blood flow through the ductus venosus for longer than the normal time after birth

A congenital defect of the vasculature such that there is a shunt (by-pass) of blood directly from the portal vein to the vena cava (i.e., the blood from the portal vein is not filtered through the liver)
Elevated concentration of galactose in the urine
Elevated concentration of galactose in the blood

trans-unit.target: Anomalía del metabolismo de la ornitina

trans-unit.source: Abnormality of a metabolism or concentration of ornithine
Increased concentration of ornithine in the blood
An abnormal accumulation of fluid and swelling in the tissues of the larynx
A benign tumor of the liver of presumably epithelial origin

trans-unit.target: Alteración del nivel de hormonas en la orina

trans-unit.source: An abnormal concentration of a hormone in the urine

trans-unit.target: Elevación del nivel de cortisol urinario

trans-unit.source: Abnormally increased concentration of cortisol in the urine
Benign neoplasia derived from lipoblasts or lipocytes of white or brown fat. May be angiomatous or hibernomatous
Presence of a lipoma in the region of the sacrum
Malignant neoplasms which probably originate in primitive mesenchymal stem cell populations differentiating down a lipomatous pathway

Multiple, localized or widespread, asymptomatic or inflammatory dermal cysts involving the pilosebaceous units. Lesions can appear anywhere on the body, but steatocystoma multiplex is more commonly involved with those areas of the skin with a high density of developed pilosebaceous units (e.g., the axilla, groin, neck, and proximal extremities)
Wasting of the sternocleidomastoid muscle, the muscle in the anterior part of the neck that acts to flex and rotate the head
Wasting of the pectoral muscles, i.e., of the pectoralis major and pectoralis minor

Corneal guttata are droplet-like accumulations of non-banded collagen on the posterior surface of Descemet's membrane. The presence of focal thickenings of Descemet's membrane histologically named guttae. Cornea guttata can be easily diagnosed in vivo and ex vivo by means of specular microscopy as it gives dark areas where no endothelial cells are visible

trans-unit.target: Pliegues en la membrana de Descemet

trans-unit.source: Presence of folds in the Descement membrane, which is the basement membrane of the endothelial (inner) cell layer of the cornea. Descement membrane folds are generally a manifestation of inflammation or edema of the cornea
Abnormal accumulation of fluid and swelling of the stroma of cornea

trans-unit.target: Disminución de la fertilidad en los hombres

trans-unit.source: A type of asthma in which aspirin and other nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) that inhibit cyclooxygen-ase 1 (COX-1) exacerbate bronchoconstriction
Rhythmic, involuntary sinusoidal oscillations of one or both eyes. The waveform of pendular nystagmus may occur in any direction

Seesaw nystagmus is a type of pendular nystagmus where a half cycle consists of the elevation and intorsion of one eye, concurrently with the depression and extortion of the fellow eye. In the other half cycle, there is an inversion of the ocular movements
Presence of multiple yellowish-white lesions of various size and configuration on the retina not related to vascular lesions
Inability to elicit tendon reflexes in the upper limbs
A visual defect characterized by the inability to see as clearly in bright light as in dim light. The word hemeralopia literally means day blindness
A kind of focal dystonia characterized by forceful contractions of the face, jaw, and/or tongue causing difficulty in opening and closing the mouth and often affecting chewing and speech

A form of focal dystonia that affects the vocal cords, associated with involuntary contractions of the vocal cords causing interruptions of speech and affecting the voice quality and often leading to patterned, repeated breaks in speech
An extreme form of generalized edema with widespread and massive edema due to effusion of fluid into the extracellular space
Hypoglycermia following a meal (or more generally, after intake of glucose)
A reduced concentration of calcitriol in the blood. Calcitriol is also known as 1,25-dihydroxycholecalciferol or 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D3
A reduced concentration of calcidiol in the blood. Calcidiol is also known as 25-hydroxycholecalciferol or 25-Hydroxyvitamin D3

Malignant tumor of melanocytes of the choroid. The classic appearance of choroidal melanoma is a pigmented dome-shaped or collar button-shaped tumor with an associated exudative retinal detachment. Choroidal melanoma is usually pigmented, but can be variably pigmented and even amelanotic (non-pigmented)
Malignant tumor of melanocytes of the ciliary body
The presence of a melanoma of the skin
A type of melanoma that is flat and irregular in shape and color, with different shades of black and brown
A type of melanoma that starts as a raised area that is usually dark blackish-blue or bluish-red but may not have any color

A subtype of melanoma in situ that typically develops on sun-damaged skin. The lesion is typically a large, irregularly pigmented macule that has developed from an ordinary lentigo (a small pigmented spot on the skin with a clearly-defined edge). Change to a malignant lentigo typically takes place over 20 years or more, and many patients accept the change as a consequence of aging

A type of cutaneous melanoma localized to the palm, sole, or beneath the nail (subungual melanoma). Acral lentiginous melanoma starts as a slowly-enlarging flat patch of discoloured skin and usually displays a size above 6 mm and often several centimetres or more in diameter upon diagnosis and variable pigmentation with a mixutre of colors including brown, and blue-grey, black and red. The surface of the lesion is initially smooth but later in the course may become thicker and irregular, and may ulcerate or bleed
Excretion of oligosaccharides conjugated to sialic acid in the urine
A fluid filled cavity that develops with a bone
Radiographic features include a dilated, radiolucent lesion typically located eccentrically within the metaphyseal portion of the bone, with fluid levels visible on magnetic resonance imaging
A benign fluid filled simple cyst of bone filled with serous fluid
Presence of multiple cystic changes in multiple ares or multiple bones

trans-unit.target: Aumento de la excreción urinaria de disacárido

trans-unit.source: Increased concentration of disaccharide in the urine
Increased excretion of glycopeptides in the urine. Glycopeptides are peptides with carbohydrate moieties covalently attached to the side chains of the amino acid residues
Excretion of excess amounts of aspartylglucosamine in the urine

trans-unit.target: Excreción de keratan sulfato en orina

trans-unit.source: An increased concentration of keratan sulfate in the urine

trans-unit.target: Excreción urinaria de sulfato de condroitina

trans-unit.source: An increased concentration of chondroitin sulfate (CHEBI:37397) in the urine
An abnormality of acylcarnitine, which is produced by reversible esterification of the 3-hydroxyl group of carnitine
Excretion of urine with an acid pH

trans-unit.target: Perfil de la acilglicina urinaria anormal

trans-unit.source: Ab abnormal distribution of N-acylglycines (CHEBI:16180) in the urine. There are numerous different N-acylglycines, and this term refers to pathological alterations in their level or distribution

An abnormality of the pupillary light reaction characterized by a marked slowing of the light reaction of usually just one pupil. The pupil tends to be relatively dilated, and there is reduced accommodation

An abnormality of mental functioning affecting the personality and behavioural tendencies of an individual and characterized by a rigid and unhealthy pattern of thinking and behavior. The definition of a personal disorder implies that the abnormality is not the result of damage or insult to the brain or from another psychiatric disorder

A personality disorder characterized by impulsive behavior and unpredictable and capricious mood. Affected individuals show a liability to outbursts of emotion and an incapacity to control the behavioural explosions

A personality disorder characterized by shallow and labile affectivity, self-dramatization, theatricality, exaggerated expression of emotions, suggestibility, egocentricity, self-indulgence, lack of consideration for others, easily hurt feelings, and continuous seeking for appreciation, excitement and attention
Blockade of impulses at a focal site along the course of a motor axon

trans-unit.target: Alteración en la conducción motora central

trans-unit.source: Any anomaly of the conduction of motor nerve impulses in the central nervous system

trans-unit.target: Atrofia de la capa granular del cerebelo

trans-unit.source: Atrophy of the cerebellum affecting primarily the granular cell layer

trans-unit.target: Aumento en el tamaño del cerebelo

trans-unit.source: An abnormally increased size of the cerebellum compared to other brain structures

trans-unit.target: Atrofia de la lámina de Purkinje del cerebelo

trans-unit.source: Atrophy of the cerebellum affecting primarily the Purkinje cell layer
Nuclear or cytoplasmic aggregates that show positive staining with antibodies against ubiquitin within cells of the brain
Abnormality of skeletal muscle fiber size
trans-unit.target: Anomalía del tamaño de la fibra muscular esquelética

trans-unit.source: Any abnormality of the size of the skeletal muscle cell
Presence of an increased number of neutrophils in the urine
An abnormal color of the urine, that is, the color of the urine appears different from the usual straw-yellow color
An anomaly in the surface contour of mitochondria
A deviation from the normal odor of the urine

trans-unit.target: Anormalidad de la morfología de páncreas
Anormalidad de la fisiología del páncreas

trans-unit.source: An anomaly of the function of the pancreas

trans-unit.target: Anormalidad de la fisiología del páncreas exocrino

trans-unit.source: A functional anomaly of the acinar gland portion of the pancreas that secretes digestive enzymes

trans-unit.target: Anormalidad de la fisiología del páncreas endocrino

trans-unit.source: A function abnormality of the endocrine pancreas
A deviation from the normal size of the pancreas
A congenital inclusion cysts that arises from ectodermal cells that normally form skin cells being left behind in the nervous system during development

A congenital inclusion cysts that arises from the inclusion of ectodermally committed cells at the time of neural tube closure (3rd-5th week of embryogenesis). The capsule of dermoid cysts consists of simple epithelium supported by collagen. In thicker parts, the lining is supplemented with dermis containing hair follicles, sebaceous glands, and apocrine glands
Edema of the dorsum of feet
trans-unit.target: Edema del dorso de los pies

trans-unit.source: An abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin on the back of the feet

trans-unit.target: Alteración del nivel plasmático de catecolaminas

trans-unit.source: An abnormal catecholamine concentration in the blood
An abnormal concentration of creatinine in the blood
An abnormally reduced amount of creatinine in the blood
A deviation from the normal number of mitochondria per cell

An anomaly of the mitochondrion, the membranous cytoplasmic organelle the interior of which is subdivided by cristae. The mitochondrion is a self replicating organelle that is the site of tissue respiration
Disproportionate shortening of the proximal segment of the leg (i.e. the femur)
Increased width of the cross sectional diameter of the fibula

A type of glaucoma with optic nerve damage in an eye with evidence of significant obstruction of the functional trabecular meshwork by the peripheral iris would be classified as having primary angle closure
A type of glaucoma with optic nerve damage in an eye that has evidence of angle closure and in which there is no evidence of a secondary cause

trans-unit.target: Alteración del nivel plasmático de glucocorticoides

trans-unit.source: An abnormality of the concentration of a glucocorticoid in the blood

trans-unit.target: Alteración del nivel plasmático de corticosterona

trans-unit.source: An abnormality of the concentration of corticosterone in the blood

trans-unit.target: Anomalía del metabolismo de la creatina

trans-unit.source: An anomaly of the concentration or homeostasis of creatine. Creatine is a derivative of glycine having methyl and amidino groups attached to the nitrogen. Creatine is naturally produced from amino acids, primarily in liver and kidney, and acts as an energy source for cells, primarly for muscle cells
A carcinoma of the endometrium, the mucous lining of the uterus
Deviation from normal concentration of albumin in the blood
Elevation in the concentration of albumin in the blood

Abnormally increased levels of Methemoglobinemia in the blood. In this form of hemoglobin, there is an oxidized ferric iron (Fe +3) rather than the reduced ferrous form (Fe 2+) that is normally found in hemoglobin. Methemoglobin has a reduced affinity for oxygen, resulting in a reduced ability to release oxygen to tissues
Increased concentration of methylmalonic acid in the urine
Inflammation of the uveal tract in which inflammation affects the anterior chamber, vitreous, retina or choroid
Inflammation of the uveal tract in which the primary site of inflammation is the anterior chamber
Inflammation of the uveal tract in which the primary site of inflammation is the retina or choroid
Inflammation of the uveal tract in which the primary site of inflammation is the vitreous
A cancer arising in any part of the stomach
Increased concentration of uracil in the urine
Death of cells in the basal ganglia
Abnormality of bone marrow stromal cells
trans-unit.target: Alteración de las células estromales de la médula ósea

trans-unit.source: Abnormality of cells of the erythroid lineage
trans-unit.target: Alteración de las células del linaje eritroide

trans-unit.source: An anomaly of erythroid lineage cells, that is, of the erythropoietic cells in the lineage leading to and including erythrocytes

trans-unit.target: Número anormal de los precursores eritroides

trans-unit.source: A deviation from the normal count of erythroid precursor cells, that is, erythroid lineage cells in the bone marrow
Increased count of erythroid precursor cells, that is, erythroid lineage cells in the bone marrow
#Bone marrow biopsy shows erythroid hyperplasia #Bone marrow smear shows erythroid hyperplasia
Decreased count of erythroid precursor cells, that is, erythroid lineage cells in the bone marrow
Abnormality of cells of the granulocytic lineage
trans-unit.target: Alteración de las células del linaje mieloide

trans-unit.source: An anomaly of cells involved in the formation of a granulocytes, that is, of the granulocytopoietic cell
Decreased number of granulocyte precursors in the bone marrow
Abnormality of cells of the lymphoid lineage
trans-unit.target: Alteración de las células del linaje linfoide

trans-unit.source: An anomaly of cells that originate from the lymphoid lineage restricted progenitor cell

trans-unit.target: Carcinoma de células escamosas de páncreas

trans-unit.source: A subtype of ductal pancreatic carcinoma that is thought to originate from squamous metaplasia of pancreatic ductal epithelium
Abnormality of cells of the megakaryocyte lineage
trans-unit.target: Alteración de las células del linaje de megacariocitos

trans-unit.source: Abnormality of cells of the monocyte/macrophage lineage
trans-unit.target: Alteración de las células del linaje de monocitos / macrófagos

trans-unit.source: Abnormality of multiple cell lineages in the bone marrow
trans-unit.target: Alteración de múltiples linajes celulares de la médula ósea

trans-unit.source: Decreased quantity or activity of von Willebrand factor. Von Willebrand factor mediates the adhesion of platelets to the collagen exposed on endothelial cell surfaces
Reduced quantity of Von Willebrand factor
trans-unit.target: Disminución de la cantidad de factor de von Willebrand

trans-unit.source: Decreased quantity of von Willebrand factor
Myelodysplasia with dysplastic changes in two or more of the myeloid lineages: erythroid, granulocytic, megakaryocytic

The cycle repeats every 45 seconds to 3 minutes

The presence of more than 5 juvenile polyps of the colon. The term juvenile polyps refer to a special histopathology and not the age of onset as the polyp might be diagnosed at all ages. #Big midface #Hypertrophy of midface #Large midface #Midfacial excess #Midfacial prominence #Overgrowth of the midface
A structural anomaly of the eye
A functional anomaly of the eye
Partial or complete loss of vision in one half of the visual field of one or both eyes
A subjective feeling of tiredness characterized by a lack of energy and motivation
An altered ability of any enzyme or their cofactors to act as catalysts. This term includes changes due to altered levels of an enzyme

trans-unit.target: Reducción de la actividad de carnitin o-palmitoitransferasa

trans-unit.source: Reduced carnitine O-palmitoyltransferase activity, i.e., reduced activity of the reaction: palmitoyl-CoA + L-carnitine = CoA + L-palmitoylcarnitine
A delay in the development of skills required to feed oneself in the toddler period (between one and three years of age)
Pattern of blood flow in the heart that deviates from the normal circuit of the circulatory system from the left side of the heart to the right
Pattern of blood flow in the heart that deviates from the normal circuit of the circulatory system from both right side of the heart to the left and vice versa
Inflammation of the nasal mucosa with nasal congestion
The distal interphalangeal joint and/or the proximal interphalangeal joint of the fingers or toes cannot be extended to 180 degrees by either active or passive extension
Aplasia of the hallux, that is, a development defect such that the big toe does not develop
#Agenesis of the halluces #Aplasia of the hallux
Inflammation of the large airways in the lung including any part of the bronchi from the primary bronchi to the tertiary bronchi
Inflammation of the large airways of the lung with rapid onset and short course usually associated with cough, mucus production, shortness of breath, wheezing, and chest tightness

trans-unit.target: Hipotonía de una o más extremidades

trans-unit.source: Muscular hypotonia of one or more limbs
A small tear in the thin, moist tissue (mucosa) that lines the anus. It appears as a crack or slit in the mucous membrane of the anus
Reduced intensity of muscle tendon reflexes in the upper limbs. Reflexes are elicited by stretching the tendon of a muscle, e.g., by tapping
Reduced intensity of muscle tendon reflexes in jaw
An allergy is an immune response or reaction to substances that are usually not harmful
Allergy to iodine contrast media used in radiological studies
An allergy experienced at a particular time of year when trees or grasses pollinate and elicit an allergic reaction
A motility disorder characterized by biliary colic in the absence of gallstones with a reduced gallbladder ejection fraction
The presence of atheromas or atherosclerotic plaques in the aorta
#Atherosclerosis of the aorta #Atherosclerotic changes of aorta
An abnormal accumulation of the accumulation of interstitial fluid in the soft tissues of the limbs

A type of ulcer that is caused when an area of skin is subject to pressure over a prolonged period of time, ranging in range in severity from patches of discolored skin to open wounds that expose the underlying bone or muscle. The most common sites are the sacrum, coccyx, heels and the hips

An abnormal concentration of aldolase in the serum. Aldolase is an enzyme responsible for converting fructose 1,6-bisphosphate into the triose phosphates dihydroxyacetone phosphate and glyceraldehyde 3-phosphate

trans-unit.target: Concentración de alfa-cetoglutarato anormal en orina

trans-unit.source: A deviation from normal of the concentration of 2-oxoglutaric acid in the urine

trans-unit.target: Aumento de la concentración de alfa-cetoglutarato en orina

trans-unit.source: A greater than normal concentration of 2-oxoglutaric acid in the urine

trans-unit.target: Concentración de alfa-cetoglutarato disminuido en orina

trans-unit.source: A lower than normal concentration of 2-oxoglutaric acid in the urine

trans-unit.target: Concentración anormal de citrato en orina

trans-unit.source: A deviation from normal of the concentration of citrate(3-) in the urine
A lower than normal concentration of citrate(3-) in the urine
A greater than normal concentration of citrate(3-) in the urine

A form of gait abnormality characterized by hypertonia and flexion in the legs, hips and pelvis accompanied by extreme adduction leading to the knees and thighs hitting, or sometimes even crossing, in a scissors-like movement. The opposing muscles (abductors) become comparatively weak from lack of use
The deposition of calcium salts in the parenchyma of the renal medulla (innermost part of the kidney)
The deposition of calcium salts in the parenchyma of the renal cortex (the outer portion of the kidney between the renal capsule and the renal medulla)

A type of anemia resuting from suppression of erythropoiesis with little or no abnormality of leukocyte or platelet production. Erythroblasts are virtually absent in bone marrow; however, leukocyte and platelet production show little or no reduction
The onset of growth of pubic hair at an earlier age than normal
Onset of adrenarche at an earlier age than usual
The presence of a V-shaped indentation (notch) in the primary central incisor
Wasting or decrease in size of all or part of the duodenum

trans-unit.target: Niveles de gases en sangre anormales

trans-unit.source: An abnormality of the partial pressure of oxygen or carbon dioxide in the arterial blood
Abnormally elevated blood carbon dioxide (CO2) level
Abnormally reduced blood carbon dioxide (CO2) level
An abnormally low level of blood oxygen
An abnormally high level of blood oxygen
Amniotic fluid containing the earliest stools of a mammalian infant
#Meconium staining of amniotic fluid #Meconium-stained amniotic fluid
Congenital lack of the skin of prepuce of penis, that is, of the double-layered fold of skin and mucous membrane that covers the glans penis

trans-unit.target: Hipertrofia de las vellosidades del plexo coroideo

trans-unit.source: #Choroid plexus hypertrophy #Diffuse villous hypertrophy of choroid plexus
The inability of the colon to modify stool to an acceptable consistency and move the stool from the cecum to the rectosigmoid area at least once every three days
An inflammation of the choroid and retina
An ulcer of the colon due to pressure and irritation from retained fecal masses

Optic disc drusen are acellular, calcified deposits within the optic nerve head. Optic disc drusen are congenital and developmental anomalies of the optic nerve head, representing hyaline-containing bodies that, over time, appear as elevated, lumpy irregularities on the anterior portion of the optic nerve

An increased degree of femoral version, which is defined as the angular difference between axis of femoral neck and transcondylar axis of the knee. Thus, femoral anteversion is an inward twisting of the femur that causes the knees and feet to turn inward
Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the cerebral white matter
trans-unit.target: Aplasia / hipoplasia de la sustancia blanca cerebral

trans-unit.source: Absence or underdevelopment of the cerebral white matter

trans-unit.target: Hipoplasia de la sustancia blanca cerebral

trans-unit.source: Underdevelopment of the cerebral white matter
Intermittent and recurrent bouts of a subjective feeling of tiredness characterized by a lack of energy and motivation
Subjective feeling of tiredness characterized by a lack of energy and motivation that persists for six months or longer
An abnormality of actions or reactions of a person taking place during interactions with others
A failure to meet one or more age-related milestones of social behavior
Reduction in length of the ventral (lower) skin of prepuce of penis

trans-unit.target: Enfermedad de arteria coronaria no oclusiva

trans-unit.source: Coronary disease that has not progressed to the point of causing significant occlusion (blockage) of the coronary arteries
#Non-occlusive coronary artery disease #Non-occlusive coronary artery stenosis #Nonocclusive coronary artery stenosis

trans-unit.target: Morfología anormal de la vesícula biliar

trans-unit.source: A structural anomaly of the gallbladder

trans-unit.target: Fisiología anormal de la vesícula biliar

trans-unit.source: A functional anomaly of the gallbladder
A functional abnormality of the biliary tree
A structural abnormality of the biliary tree
Reduced motility through the sphincter of Oddi, resulting in impedance of bile and pancreatic juice flow from the common bile duct into the duodenum
Reduced motility of the gallbladder with reduced emptying fraction
A structural abnormality of the brain, which has as its parts the forebrain, midbrain, and hindbrain
Partial or complete wasting (loss) of brain tissue that was once present

trans-unit.target: Nivel bajo de 5-metiltetrahidrofolato en líquido cefaloraquídeo

trans-unit.source: A reduced concentration of 5-methyltetrahydrofolate(2-) in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF). 5-methyltetrahydrofolate is the active folate metabolite
Any anomaly in the process by which myelin sheaths are formed and maintained around neurons
Inflammation of the synovial membrane of the sacroiliac joint
Constipation for longer than three months with fewer than 3 bowel movements per week, straining, lumpy or hard stools, and a sensation of anorectal obstruction or incomplete defecation
Constipation of sudden onset and lasting for less than three months
A feeling of uneasiness and restlessness in the legs after going to bed (sometimes causing insomnia)

trans-unit.target: Contractura en flexión bilateral de la muñeca

trans-unit.source: A chronic loss of wrist joint motion on the right and left sides

trans-unit.target: Contractura unilateral en flexión de la muñeca

trans-unit.source: A chronic loss of wrist joint motion on one side only
Calcification, that is, pathological deposition of calcium salts, of the large, conduit arteries (aorta, subclavian, carotid, iliac, renal, axillary, femoral, brachial)

trans-unit.target: Calcificación arterial en la capa media

trans-unit.source: Calcification, that is, pathological deposition of calcium salts in the tunica media of arteries

trans-unit.target: Calcificación de la media de las arterias de tamaño mediano

trans-unit.source: Calcification, that is, pathological deposition of calcium salts in the tunica media of medium-sized (muscular or distributive) arteries

trans-unit.target: Calcificación de la media de las arterias pequeñas

trans-unit.source: Calcification, that is, pathological deposition of calcium salts in the tunica media of small arteries
A headache disorder that occurs exclusively at night, waking the affected individual from sleep
A structural anomaly of the inferior portion of the vermis of cerebellum
The presence of bacteria in the urine
Involuntary and irregular twitches of the chin
An above normal level of saturation of serum transferrin with iron

trans-unit.target: Disminución de la saturación de la transferrina

trans-unit.source: A below normal level of saturation of serum transferrin with iron
An increased level of iron in liver tissues

Longstanding impairment in ventilation such that the partial pressure of carbon dioxide (PaCO2) is elevated above the upper limit of the reference range (more than 45 mm Hg), with a normal or near-normal pH secondary to renal compensation and an elevated serum bicarbonate levels (more than30 mEq/L)

Sudden onset of impairment in ventilation such that the removal of carbon dioxide by the respiratory system is less than the production of carbon dioxide in the tissues, leading to an elevation of the partial pressure of carbon dioxide (PaCO2) above the normal limits (more than 45 mm Hg) with an accompanying acidemia (pH less than 7.35)
Longstanding abnormal acid accumulation or depletion of base
Infantile spasms represent a subset of "epileptic spasms". Infantile Spasms are epileptic spasms starting in the first year of life (infancy)

An ophthalmologic sign in young children resulting from upward-gaze paresis. In this condition, the eyes appear driven downward, the sclera may be seen between the upper eyelid and the iris, and part of the lower pupil may be covered by the lower eyelid
Increased width of the "skin of vermilion border region of upper lip" (FMA:312645)
A turning outward of the lip or lips, that is, eversion of the lips
Complete obstruction of a carotid artery
The presence of normal overall immunoglobulin levels with deficiency of specific immunoglobulins directed against a specific antigen or microorganism
The presence of normal overall immunoglobulin levels with deficiency of specific immunoglobulins directed against pneumococci

A wavering, unsteady voice that reflects involuntary and approximately sinusoidal oscillation of motor unit firings of laryngeal muscles. Vocal tremor results in low frequency modulations of voice frequency or amplitude and intermittent voice instability
Fusion of the mandibular condyle to the base of the skull, resulting in limitation of jaw opening
Noises from the temporomandibular joint during mandibular movement (e.g., chewing). Temporomandibular joint crepitus is often described as a clicking, popping, grating sound

A congenital malformation of veins which drain normal brain characterized by a caput medusae or an umbrellalike convergence of multiple venules on a single, or occasionally multiple, enlarged parenchymal or medullary vein, like the trunk of a tree or the shank of an umbrella. This dilated terminal vein penetrates the cortex to drain either (a) superficially to cortical veins or sinuses, (b) deeply to subependymal veins of the lateral ventricle and then into the galenic system, (c) to the fourth ventricle and then to the pontomesencephalic vein, or (d) to the precentral cerebellar vein and into the galenic system
A venous angioma of the frontal lobe of the brain
Defective structure, size or content of alpha granules, platelet organelles that contain several growth factors destined for release during platelet activation at sites of vessel wall injury

Defective structure, size or content of dense granules, platelet organelles that contain granules proaggregatory factors such as adenosine diphosphate (ADP), adenosine triphosphate (ATP), ionized calcium , histamine and serotonin

trans-unit.target: Sistema canalicular abierto conectado a la superficie anormal

trans-unit.source: An anomaly of the invaginations of the surface membrane that form the open canalicular system (OCS). The OCS serve as the pathway for transport of substances into the cells and as conduits for the discharge of alpha granule products secreted during the platelet release reaction
An arachnoid cyst located at the margin of the cerebellum and pons
An arachnoid cyst located within the ventricular system

An arachnoid cyst that progressively enlarges from an abnormality in the membrane of Liliequist or in the interpeduncular cistern, and typically, expands from the prepontine space, displacing the floor of the third ventricle upwards, the pituitary stalk and optic chiasm upwards and forwards, and the mammillary bodies upwards and backwards
An anomaly of the intracellular membrane complexes known as the dense tubular system
Narrowing or constriction of the inner surface (lumen) of a cerebral artery

trans-unit.target: Estenosis de la arteria cerebral media

trans-unit.source: Narrowing or constriction of the inner surface (lumen) of the middle cerebral artery

trans-unit.target: Estenosis de la arteria cerebral anterior

trans-unit.source: Narrowing or constriction of the inner surface (lumen) of the anterior cerebral artery

trans-unit.target: Estenosis de la arteria cerebral posterior

trans-unit.source: Narrowing or constriction of the inner surface (lumen) of the posterior cerebral artery

trans-unit.target: Reducción de la presión inspiratoria máxima

trans-unit.source: A decrease in the maximum amount of negative pressure a person can generate during an inhalation

trans-unit.target: Reducción de la presión espiratoria máxima

trans-unit.source: A decrease in the maximum amount of pressure of expired air achieved by a person after a full inspiration
A complication of pregnancy and delivery in which the umbilical cord wraps around the fetal neck once or multiple times

A separation of the layers within the wall of the descending aorta. Tears in the intimal layer result in the propagation of dissection (proximally or distally) secondary to blood entering the intima-media space
A wartlike (with multiple small elevated projections) papule
Abnormality of the brainstem white matter
trans-unit.target: Anomalía de la sustancia blanca del tallo cerebral

trans-unit.source: An anomaly of the white matter of brainstem
An anomaly of the internal capsule, which is an area of white matter in the brain that separates the caudate nucleus and the thalamus from the putamen and the globus pallidus
An anomaly of the pituitary gland

trans-unit.target: Tamaño anormal de la glándula pituitaria

trans-unit.source: A deviation from the normal size of the pituitary gland
An abnormally increased size of the pituitary gland
An abnormally decreased size of the pituitary gland

trans-unit.target: Debilidad del músculo orbicular de los párpados

trans-unit.source: Reduced strength of the orbicularis oculi, the circumorbital muscle in the face that closes the eyelid
A visual anomaly in which images appear distorted. A grid of straight lines appears wavy and parts of the grid may appear blank
An abnormally decreased amount of thyroxin-binding globulin (TBG) in blood. TBG is responsible for carrying the thyroid hormones thyroxine (T4) and 3,5,3'-triiodothyronine (T3) in the bloodstream
An increased amount of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) in the subarachnoid space

trans-unit.target: Palidez de región temporal del disco óptico

trans-unit.source: A pale yellow discoloration of the temporal (lateral) portion of the optic disc
A pale yellow discoloration of the entire optic disc
An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the arm
An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the leg

trans-unit.target: Debilidad de la flexión de la cadera

trans-unit.source: Reduced ability to flex the femur, that is, to pull the knee upward
Tetralogy of Fallot with pulmonary atresia
trans-unit.target: Tetralogía de Fallot con atresia pulmonar

trans-unit.source: An extreme form of tetralogy of Fallot characterized by absence of flow from the right ventricle to the pulmonary arteries

trans-unit.target: Reducción de la actividad de la catalasa

trans-unit.source: An abnormally decreased amount of catalase activity
An anomaly of the circle of Willis, also known as the cerebral arterial circle

Increased dimensions of the Virchow-Robin spaces (also known as perivascular spaces), which surround the walls of vessels as they course from the subarachnoid space through the brain parenchyma. Perivascular spaces are commonly microscopic, and not visible on conventional neuroimaging. This term refers to an increase of size of these spaces such that they are visible on neuroimaging (usually magnetic resonance imaging). The dilatations are regular cavities that always contain a patent artery
#Dilatation of Virchow-Robin spaces #Dilated cerebral perivascular spaces #Dilated Virchow-Robin spaces
Congenital absence of the optic nerve

A form of telangiectasis characterized by a central elevated red dot the size of a pinhead, representing an arteriole, with numerous small blood vessels that radiate out thereby resembling the legs of a spider. Characteristically, compression of the central arteriole causes the entire lesion to blanch, and the lesion quickly refills once the compression is released

Reluctance or refusal of a child to be breastfed or eat, manifested as gagging, vomiting, turning head away from food, or avoidance of sensation in or around the mouth (i.e. toothbrushing or face-washing)
A deviation from the normal discoid platelet shape
An anomalous location and arrangement of platelet alpha granules
A lack of platelet alpha granules

A deviation from the normal contents of the platelet alpha granules, which normally contain hemostatic proteins such as fibrinogen, von Willebrand factor, and growth factors such as platelet-derived growth factor
A deviation from the normal count of alpha granules per thrombocyte

A deviation from the normal contents of the platelet alpha granules, which normally contain adenosine triphosphate (ATP), adenosine diphosphate (ADP), serotonin, calcium, and pyrophosphate, which are secreted when platelets are activated
A deviation from the normal count of dense granules per thrombocyte
An unpleasant sensory and emotional experience associated with actual or potential tissue damage, or described in terms of such damage
Persistent pain, usually defined as pain that has laster longer than 3 to 6 months
Pain due to a stimulus that does not normally provoke pain
Abnormal sensations with no apparent physical cause that are painful or unpleasant

An anomaly in the communication from a neuron to a target across a synapse. This is a four step process, comprising (i) synthesis and storage of neurotransmitters; (ii) neurotransmitter release; (iii) activation of postsynaptic receptors by the neurotransmitter; and (iv) inactivation of the neurotransmitter. Thus, this term is defined as an anomaly of neurotransmitter metabolic process
The presence of circulating autoantibodies to anticardiolipin in the mother
A detrimental reaction to a food, beverage, food additive, or compound found in foods that produces symptoms in one or more body organs and systems that is not mediated by an immune reaction
A detrimental reaction to the presence of gluten in food, which may include abdominal pain, fatigue, headaches and paresthesia, or celiac disease
A typer of lymphoma characterized microscopically by the absence of multinucleated Reed-Sternberg cells
An epidermoid cyst in the armpit
Hemorrhage between the skull and periosteum of a newborn resulting from rupture of blood vessels that cross the periosteum
The presence of hemosiderin in the urine
An increased concentration of fructose 1,6-bisphosphate aldolase in the serum
An decreased concentration of fructose 1,6-bisphosphate aldolase in the serum

trans-unit.target: Inactivación preferencial del cromosoma X materna

trans-unit.source: A deviation from equal (50%) inactivation of each parental X chromosome in maternal cells
Anomalous movements of the eyes that occur without the subject wanting them to happen
Muscle fibers degeneration resulting in fatty replacement of skeletal muscle fibers
A lipoma (a benign tumor composed of adipose tissue) located in the conjunctiva
The presence of varices (enlarged and convoluted blood vessels) in the colon

trans-unit.target: Ausencia de los gránulos específicos de neutrófilos

trans-unit.source: Lack of specific granules in neutrophils

trans-unit.target: Aumento de las proyecciones nucleares de los neutrófilos

trans-unit.source: Presence of an elevanted number of projections from nuclei of neutrophils. Ths projections can have the shape of hooks, tags, or clubs

trans-unit.target: Hipoplasia de la uña del pulgar

trans-unit.source: A thumbnail that is diminished in length and width, i.e., underdeveloped thumb nail
#Absent big toe nail #Absent nail of big toe
Increased concentration of beta-alanine in the blood
EEG with centrotemporal focal spike waves
trans-unit.target: EEG con ondas pico focales centrotemporales

trans-unit.source: EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the centrotemporal region of the brain (also known as the central sulcus), i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave
A ratio of serum triiodothyronine (T3) to thyroxine (T4) in the blood that deviates from normal
A ratio of serum triiodothyronine (T3) to thyroxine (T4) in the blood that is higher than normal
A ratio of serum triiodothyronine (T3) to thyroxine (T4) in the blood that is lower than normal
The presence of an aortic valve with one instead of the normal three cusps (flaps)

trans-unit.target: Fusión epimetafisiaria prematura en la mano

trans-unit.source: Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at one or more long bones in the hand, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone

trans-unit.target: Fusión epimetafisiaria prematura en el pie

trans-unit.source: Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at one or more long bones in the foot, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone

trans-unit.target: Fusión epimetafisiaria prematura en la tibia

trans-unit.source: Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at one or more long bones in the tibia, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone

trans-unit.target: Fusión epimetafisiaria prematura en el peroné

trans-unit.source: Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at one or more long bones in the fibula, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone

Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at one or more long bones in the radius, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone

trans-unit.target: Fusión epimetafisiaria prematura en el cúbito

trans-unit.source: Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at one or more long bones in the ulna, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone
Edema in the region of the Lower eyelid
First period after the age of 15 years
A type of mesenchymal tissue cell tumor that exhibits epithelial differentiation, which most frequently arises in the extremities
A partial duplication of the ureter such that the duplicated ureters fuse to a single ureter before their insertion into the bladder
A complete duplication of the ureter such that the duplicated ureters with separate insertions into the bladder

A type of proximal renal tubulopathy characterized by resorption defects leading to glycosuria, aminoaciduria, tubular proteinuria, renal hypophosphatemia, and urate tubular hyporeabsorption with bicarbonate loss and resulting acidosis
Increased numbers of mesangial cells per glomerulus
A structural anomaly of the nephron
The presence of complement 3 deposits in the glomerulus
Reduction in thickness of the basal lamina of the glomerulus of the kidney
A type of glomerulonephropathy characterized by thickening of the basement membrane and deposition of immune complexes in the subepithelial space
The presence of minimal changes visible by light microscopy but flattened and fused podocyte foot processes on electron microscopy in a person with nephrotic range proteinuria
The presence of calcium- and phosphate-containing calculi (stones) in the kidneys
An isolated cyst of the kidney
A bilateral form of developmental dysplasia of the kidney
One sided hypoplasia of the kidney
Two sided hypoplasia of the kidney
A two-sided form of atrophy of the kidney
Hematuria that is visible upon inspection of the urine
A form of nephrotic syndrome that does not respond to treatment with steroid medication

trans-unit.target: Síndrome nefrótico resistente a múltiples fármacos

trans-unit.source: A form of nephrotic syndrome that does not respond to any immunosuppresive treatment
Ab abnormal amount of urine production
Increased concentration of albumin in the urine
Severely increased amount of excretion of protein in the urine, defined as 3.5 grams per day or more in adults and 40 mg per meter-squared body surface area per hour in children
The presence of mildly increased concentrations of albumin in the urine (in adults, 30-150 mg per day)
Mildly increased levels of protein in the urine (150-500 mg per day in adults)
Moderately increased levels of protein in the urine (500-1000 mg per day in adults)
Severely increased levels of protein in the urine (1000-3000 mg per day in adults)
An abnormal concentration of potassium(1+) in the urine
An abnormal phosphate concentration in the urine

An decreased concentration of chloride in the urine
High urine chloride in the presence of hypochloridemia
An abnormal concentration of sodium in the urine
An abnormally decreased sodium concentration in the urine
An increased concentration of sodium(1+) in the urine
An abnormally increased sodium concentration in the urine in the presence of hyponatremia

trans-unit.target: Concentración de magnesio anormal de la orina

trans-unit.source: An abnormal concentration of magnesium the urine
An increased concentration of magnesium the urine
An decreased concentration of magnesium the urine
Abnormality of urinary uric acid concentration
trans-unit.target: Anormalidad en la concentración de ácido úrico urinario

trans-unit.source: Abnormal concentration of urate in the urine
Elevanted concentration of urate in the urine
Abnormal concentration of sulfate in the urine
Elevated concentration of sulfate in the urine
An anomalous finding in the examination of the urine for cells
The presence of renal casts (cylindrical structures produced by the kidney in certain disease states) in the urine
Presence of leukocyte casts (cylindrical structures produced by the kidney in certain disease states) in the urine
Presence of erythrocyte casts (cylindrical structures produced by the kidney in certain disease states) in the urine
A cyst located along the allantois canal
Presence of a many diverticula (sac or pouch) in the wall of the urinary bladder
A developmental anomaly associated with the failure of rectum, vagina, and bladder to separate
Developmental anomaly in which the vagina, bladder, and rectum fuse resulting in a common channel
Functional anomaly of the kidney persisting for at least three months
#Loss of renal function #Progressive renal failure #Progressive renal insufficiency #Renal failure, progressive #Renal insufficiency, progressive
A type of chronic kidney disease with normal or increased glomerular filtration rate (GFR at least 90 mL/min/1.73 m2)
A type of chronic kidney disease with mildly reduced glomerular filtration rate (GFR 60-89 mL/min/1.73 m2)
A type of chronic kidney disease with moderately reduced glomerular filtration rate (GFR 30-59 mL/min/1.73 m2)
A type of chronic kidney disease with severely reduced glomerular filtration rate (GFR 15-29 mL/min/1.73 m2)
Deposition of fibrillar material that can be found on all anterior segment structures bathed by aqueous humor
Abnormality of the suspensory ligament of lens
trans-unit.target: Anomalía del ligamento suspensorio del cristalino

trans-unit.source: An anomaly of the suspensory ligament of lens, also known as the ciliary zonule. These ligaments represent a series of fibers connecting the ciliary body and lens of the eye, holding the lens in place
Tremulousness (trembling) of the lens of the eye

An anomaly of the trabecular meshwork, which is the porelike structure surrounding the entire circumference of the anterior chamber at the base of the cornea and near the ciliary body. The trabecular mesh work is responsible for draining the aqueous humor into the canal of Schlemm
Pigment deposition in the trabecular meshwork
trans-unit.target: Depósitos de pigmento en la malla trabecular

trans-unit.source: Accumulation of abnormal amounts of pigment within the trabecular meshwork
An anomaly in the amount of force per unit area exerted by the intraocular fluid within the eye
A difference in the amount of intraocular pressure in the right and left eye
Shedding of the pigment granules that normally adhere to the back of the iris into the aqueous humor
Reduction in the amount of blood flow to the iris
High urine calcium in the presence of hypocalcemia

trans-unit.target: Alteración en la fisiología del sistema nervioso

trans-unit.source: A functional anomaly of the nervous system

trans-unit.target: Alteración en la morfología del sistema nervioso

trans-unit.source: A structural anomaly of the nervous system
A deviation from the norm of the intracranial pressure
A reduction of the pressure inside the cranium (skull) and thereby in the brain tissue and cerebrospinal fluid
Lack of development of the cerebellum
Decreased amount of pigmentation in the fovea centralis

trans-unit.target: Aumento de lactato en núcleo caudado

trans-unit.source: An elevated concentration of lactate in the caudate nucleus. This finding can be elicited by magnetic resonance spectroscopy imaging

trans-unit.target: Aumento en el tamaño de nervios periféricos

trans-unit.source: Increase in size of a peripheral nerve. This finding can be appreciated by palpation along the axis of the nerve

A testis that is located at the upper scrotum or lower inguinal canal and that can be made to descend completely into the scrotum without resistance by manual reduction but returns to its original position by the cremasteric reflex

Any anomaly of the inflammatory response, a response to injury or infection characterized by local vasodilation, extravasation of plasma into intercellular spaces and accumulation of white blood cells and macrophages

This subontology is designed to provide terms to characterize and specify the phenotypic abnormalities defined in the Phenotypic abnormality subontology, with respect to severity, laterality, age of onset, and other aspects
The intensity or degree of a manifestation
Having a relatively minor degree of severity. For quantitative traits, a deviation of between two and three standard deviations from the appropriate population mean
Having a medium degree of severity. For quantitative traits, a deviation of between three and four standard deviations from the appropriate population mean

Having a minor degree of severity that is considered to be on the boundary between the normal and the abnormal ranges. For quantitative traits, a deviation of that is less than two standard deviations from the appropriate population mean
Having a high degree of severity. For quantitative traits, a deviation of between four and five standard deviations from the appropriate population mean
Having an extremely high degree of severity. For quantitative traits, a deviation of more than five standard deviations from the appropriate population mean
The anatomical localization of the specified phenotypic abnormality
The localization with respect to the side of the body of the specified phenotypic abnormality
Being present on both sides of the body
Being present on only the left or only the right side of the body
Being located on the right side of the body
Being located on the left side of the body
The pattern by which a phenotype affects one or more regions of the body
Affecting all regions without specificity of distribution
Being confined or restricted to a particular location
Localized away from the central point of the body
Localized close to the central point of the body
The presence of an increased number of twists and turns of the retinal blood vessels
An uncontrolled autonomous cell-proliferation originating in a hair follicle, which is an epidermal adnexal structures responsible for hair growth
A benign tumour originating from the outer root sheath of the hair follicle
Presence of a unitary trichilemmoma, a benign tumour originating from the outer root sheath of the hair follicle
Presence of multiple trichilemmomata, a benign tumour originating from the outer root sheath of the hair follicle
A form of partial status epilepticus with simple motor manifestations that are maintained for over one hour, with clonic activity restricted to one body part and recurring at fairly regular intervals
The narrowing or partial blockage of a portion of the small intestine

Increased pigmentation (skin color) of the scrotum

Decreased number or density of the folded ridges (wrinkles) of skin of the scrotum

Formation of excess connective tissue in the testicle

Any structural anomaly of a reproductive cell

Spermatozoa with very small cranial ends devoid of any nuclear material, that is, lacking a typical sperm head

A condition which is considered to be due to the subsequent atrophy and disappearance in fetal life of an initially normal testis. In the presence of spermatic cord structures is evidence of the presence of the testis in early intrauterine life. When associated with a blind-ending spermatic cord, this entity is named as his absence of a testis in an otherwise normal 46XY male is usually unilateral and is assumed to be a consequence of intrauterine or perinatal torsion or infarction

A varicocele is a widening of the veins along the spermatic cord, leading to enlarged, twisted veins in the scrotum, and manifested clinically by a painless testicle lump, scrotal swelling, or bulge in the scrotum

trans-unit.target: Morfología anormal de los conductos deferentes

The emission of semen and seminal fluid during the act of preparation for sexual intercourse, i.e. before there is penetration, or shortly after penetration

Difficulty of a male in achieving orgasm

An anomaly of the outer labia

The presence of a supernumerary Fallopian tube

A cystic tumor of the ovary, containing thin, clear, yellow serous fluid and varying amounts of solid tissue

Abnormality observed upon electromyography when nerve studied is electrically stimulated six to ten times at 2 or 3 Hertz
A condition in which the eyelids do not close to cover the eye completely
The inability to close the eyelids during sleep
A type of lagophthalmos that occurs in association with facial nerve palsy
A type of lagophthalmos that occurs following trauma or surgery

An acute phenomenon characterized by hypotension and anasarca due to the loss of plasma volume into peripheral tissues, with evidence of decreased plasma volume (hemoconcentration) and protein loss from the intravascular space (hypoalbuminemia) during acute episodes
Abnormality in single fiber EMG recording, a technique that allows identification of action potentials (APs) from individual muscle fibers

These are spontaneous firing action potentials stimulated by needle movement of an injured muscle fiber. There is propagation to, but not past, the needle tip. This inhibits the display of the negative deflection of the waveform
A cervix that shows a painless dilation and shortening during the second trimester of pregnancy with resultant recurrent pregnancy loss or delivery is considered incompetent
Hydrometrocolpos is an accumulation of uterine and vaginal secretions as well as menstrual blood in the uterus and vagina
A congenital disorder where the hymen (a membrane that surrounds or partially covers the external vaginal opening) does not have an opening and completely obstructs the vagina
The persistent of recurrent difficulty, delay in, or absence of attaining orgasm following sufficient sexual stimulation and arousal
Recurrent or persistent genital pain associated with sexual intercourse
Recurrent or persistent involuntary spasms of the musculature of the outer third of the vagina that interferes with vaginal penetration, and which causes personal distress

Variably shaped, cartilage-containing tissue anterior to the external auditory meatus

Flattening instead of curving or rounded superior helix, allowing the superior helix to run more horizontally than usual
